title: [Self-directed] Analysis of Factors Influencing Mobile Learning Adoption in Higher Education Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Social Science Research Methodology and Educational Technology
context.additional_context: Research on m-learning adoption factors through a social science approach, enhancing empirical data collection and analysis competencies in offline classroom settings utilizing digital devices.

learning_goals: Learners design surveys including a 5-item+ Likert scale and three open-ended questions to analyze mobile learning adoption factors (relative advantage, complexity, social influence), achieving over 80% suitability in peer reviews and instructor rubrics (clarity, validity, practicality).

Learners use SPSS/R to handle missing values, perform descriptive statistics (mean, standard deviation), chi-square tests, and Pearson correlations on empirical datasets (e.g., social survey data), and visualize results in three or more formats (histograms, scatterplots, cross-tabulations).
Writing a proposal for m-learning strategies suitable for higher education environments based on research findings.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
